title: Australia starts gun buyback after attack at Hanukkah event
snippets: Albanese said Australia has more guns now than 30 years ago, when the country's deadliest-ever mass shooting took place.
It is the largest scheme since the Port Arthur massacre in 1996, which prompted massive gun law reform.
Hundreds of thousands of firearms are expected to be handed into authorities, Australia’s prime minister said, as a result of a raft of planned gun-control measures.
The program is expected to take hundreds of thousands of firearms out of circulation, the prime minister said on Friday.
New legislation will be drafted to target those who promote violence and to increase penalties for hate speech, the prime minister said Thursday.

Prime minister announces first firearm buyback since Port Arthur massacre, and designates Sunday a national day of reflection in honour of Hanukah shooting victims Victims of Bondi beach shooting Ten minutes of terror: how the Bondi mass shooting unfolded in real time – video Follow the latest live
Australia Launches Gun Buyback After Bondi Terror Attack Bloomberg.com
Sydney’s devastated Jewish community gathered for the funeral of “Matilda Bee,” an ebullient, smiling 10-year-old girl.
Australia will launch a national gun buyback scheme in the aftermath of a deadly attack on a Hanukkah celebration at Sydney's Bondi Beach last weekend, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Friday.
titles: Australia PM Albanese launches gun ‘buyback’ plan after Bondi Beach attack
Australia announces gun buyback scheme in wake of Bondi attack

Australia to Crack Down on Hate Speech After Bondi Beach Attack

Australia Launches Gun Buyback After Bondi Terror Attack - Bloomberg.com

constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful information about a new policy response to a recent incident. It offers insight into the decision-making process of the government, potentially aiding readers in understanding the situation and forming their own opinions. However, without details on the plan's potential impacts or effectiveness, it doesn't fully highlight progress or solutions.
summary: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced a national gun buyback scheme following a deadly attack at a Hanukkah celebration on Sydney's Bondi Beach. The program, the largest since the 1996 Port Arthur massacre, aims to remove hundreds of thousands of firearms from circulation. New legislation will also be drafted to address hate speech and violence. Sunday has been designated a national day of reflection to honor the victims.

title: ByteDance agrees to sell most of TikTok in the United States
snippets: The deals would end years of efforts by Washington to force ByteDance to sell its US operations.
TikTok's Chinese owner, ByteDance, agreed to sell a majority of its US assets to a group of investors.
The agreement aims to resolve a yearslong standoff between the popular social media platform and the U.S. government over national security concerns tied to China's parent company, ByteDance.

TikTok signs deal to form new US unit with investors, including Oracle, Silver Lake AP News
The deal comes more than a year after Congress passed a law that forced its owner ByteDance to divest its US operations or face a ban.
The deal closes a long-running drama in which U.S. authorities have sought to compel ByteDance to divest.
TikTok's U.S. operations will be housed in a new joint venture, according to a memo sent to employees by CEO Shou Zi Chew.

This agreement follows a law passed by Congress requiring ByteDance to divest its U.S. assets or face a ban.

title: EU leaders agree to give Ukraine a large loan for support

Money to be borrowed against bloc’s budget after leaders fail to agree on proposal using Moscow’s funds

The loan will be financed through EU borrowing backed by the bloc’s budget, after leaders failed to agree on using frozen Russian assets. The decision covers most of Ukraine’s urgent financial requirements.

The executive order reclassifies marijuana as a Schedule III drug, easing the path for more research.

title: Michael King signs three year deal with San Diego Padres
snippets: Right-hander Michael King and the San Diego Padres agreed to a three-year, $75 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Thursday.

Michael King is staying put. The right-hander has signed a three-year, $75 million deal with the San Diego Padres , ESPN’s Jeff Passan reported on Thursday. King made just 15 starts with the San Diego Padres last season after dealing with shoulder and knee ailments. He had a 5-3 record and posted a 3.44 ERA. The Rochester, N.Y., native began his MLB career with the New York Yankees in 2019. After the 2023 campaign, he was traded to the Padres as part of the Juan Soto blockbuster trade. In his first full year in San Diego, King was converted to a starter, where he excelled in his first season....

summary: Right-handed pitcher Michael King has agreed to a three-year, $75 million contract with the San Diego Padres, according to ESPN on December 19, 2025. King, who joined the Padres from the New York Yankees after the 2023 season, posted a 5-3 record and a 3.44 ERA in 15 starts last season despite injuries.
